TOPIC.HEAD: ISE Help tool
TOPIC.TEXT: Welcome to the help for this help-program. As you can see, the window is divided in a left and right section divided by a splitter. You can move the splitter if you want to enlarge any of the two sections.

There is a program available that converts the FrameMaker 5.5.6 XML output into our help-document format. Note: the current version only detects these tags: Section headers: xx-chapter, xx-sec2, xx-sec3 Body text: xx-first, xx-normal, xx-small Bulleted list items: xx-bull, xx-bullnum The xx- part can be any character (nn-, bb-, ll-) or can be omitted.
It also displays text in tables, but not formatted at all.

TOPIC.HEAD: About XML
TOPIC.TEXT:
Help documents are written in XML. XML stands for eXtensible Markup Language. For this help tool, some new tags were defined. These are the new tags:
EIFFEL_DOCUMENT: Every help-file starts with this tag.
TOPIC: Define a new help-topic.
HEAD: The title of the topic.
TEXT: The body text of a topic.
Furthermore, in the TEXT-tag, you can use some tags that are also available in HTML like:
B: Bold.
I: Italic.
U: Underline. (does not work yet)
A: Anchor.
FONT: Font properties.
UL: Unnumbered list.
LI: List-item.
BR: Line break.
There is one extra tag:
IMP: Add the words between these tags to the search-index.
In a single file there can be only one (root)-topic. Every topic must have a HEAD tag in it. There can be either subtopics or text contained in a topic. You can put as many subtopics or text-paragraphs in it as you want.

TOPIC.HEAD: The first tab: 'Tree'
TOPIC.TEXT: The first tab of the this help tool enables you to browse through the topics in a hierarchical way.

TOPIC.HEAD: The second tab: 'Index'
TOPIC.TEXT: The second tab lets you to browse through the topics in alphabetical order. Just type the first few characters of the topic and select it from the list.

TOPIC.HEAD: The third tab: 'Search'
TOPIC.TEXT: You can use the search-tab to search for keywords. The topics with that word then appear in the list.

TOPIC.HEAD: The topic display area
TOPIC.TEXT: On the right of the window the help topics are displayed. If you want to copy some text from it, select your text or source code and choose File|Copy from the menu.
